column5: Walleye jig gold or white pike orange/black hairpin spinner bait 5/8 oz Later, Jay

Walleye - VMC Moon Eye Jig head in purple/white with a fathead minnowNorthern Pike - Silver Spoon at least 4 long with a treblehook (but then again Northern hit anything)I don't fish for troutSent from my iPad using Tapatalk
Northern will hit a finger if you get it in its way!

Walleye 1/4oz. jig with a 3" paddletail minnow or curly tail grub Pike Tied between: 3.75" 1 1/8oz. Johnson's Silver Minnow tipped with a 5" white grub 4.5" 1 3/16 oz. Yellow Bird Doctor Spoon 4 7/8" 1 1/8oz Len Thompson #4 Spoon Trout 22 or 44 Sutton Spoon I love fishing spoons. So easy to throw all day long on lighter gear and very effective.
If I were going fishing and only took 1 lure it would be a Z-man Ned rig. TRD finesse in 1/5 oz head. NO bait. Model No. TRD275-354PK8 TW Delta Green Pumpkin
Favorite lure that will catch all three? A bright shiny blade bait. Can be jigged, cast or trolled.

Walleye: 1/4oz glow white jig and a minnow. For artificial baits I'd say a white jerkbait if they're shallow and a dropshot if they're deep.Pike: blue and silver Doctor spoon.Lake trout: 1oz glow white tube jig tipped with a sucker minnow
Rapala DHJ-12. Blue Chrome if I had to pick one color.Sent from my SM-S901U using Tapatalk

I use a Mepps Walleye Killer, white with pink blade for walleye. Have had good success with neon swim baits. Bass jig with a 3 shiner pattern or white power grub. I've caught bass in just about everything in my box. I used a few lures I had left over from my Grandpa that he had from the 50's. Caught a fish and retired them. Never fished for lake trout. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

My go to’s are - Blue and silver williams wabbler. Thinderstick in firetiger pattern, and a split inbetween a bottom bouncer with a worm harness or a worm and a slip bobber. Cant exclude an Xrap either
